clues.text: The death of this inventor of course brought telegrams, like Brigham Young's "My affections follow him to the spirit world"
As World War II began, the Royal Navy was cheered up by a telegram saying this politician "is back"
In 1964 he wired MLK offering to "dispatch some of our brothers" to give the KKK "a taste of its own medicine"
In April 1861 Robert Anderson cabled that, down to 4 barrels of powder & only pork to eat, he had surrendered this fort
A panicky telegram about Native Americans dancing in the snow brought an influx of troops & led to this 1890 massacre
The Fairlight CMI type of this electronic instrument is heard on many '80s songs like "Shock the Monkey" & "Shout"
The organ in West Point's Cadet Chapel has about 23,500 of these
The strings of the clavichord were struck by small blades; this "chord" was the first keyboard instrument to work by plucking
First seen in the comics on May 30, 1951, this Beethoven aficionado is the most famous virtuoso on the toy piano
In German, Harmonika can also mean this other wheezy instrument, possibly invented by the same guy

Louise Fitzhugh:
"Harriet the ____"

Thomas Hardy:
"The ____ of Casterbridge"

John le Carre:
"The Night ____"

John Fowles:
"The French ____'s Woman"

C.S. Lewis:
"The ____'s Nephew"
This 1970s band wore outrageous costumes because of a Swedish tax law allowing deductions for non-street clothes
This Disney Channel series was originally going to be called "Alexis Texas"
Peter Laird, co-creator of these comic book heroes, wishes the cartoon had not made them so obsessed with pizza
Marina Toybina made dancing sharks for Katy Perry's Super Bowl show & designs the elaborate disguises for this reality competition
This movie director of "Slumdog Millionaire" & "Trainspotting" also directed the London Olympics opening ceremonies
In zoology, this hyphenated adjective refers to the body temperature of reptiles
This term can refer to a cheap saloon, the type of music played there or the "Women" in a Rolling Stones song
Long cycle times & mold can be issues with this type of washing machine, as opposed to the kind where clothes go in the top
This newer hyphenated verb refers to the viewing & mocking of bad TV for entertainment
2FA is short for this type of online authentication
This set of curved bones attaches to the sternum
In humans, this bone is the thigh; in other animals, it's the hind leg
The hip bones, the ilium & the ischium are part of this complex of bones that joins the legs & the trunk
Though its name is shorter, this forearm bone is slightly longer than the radius
The maxilla is the fixed upper bone of this
The Valley one at Oregon State & the Ablah one at Wichita State have special quiet zones--shouldn't the whole place be one?
Fountains, this type of place in Britain, was founded in 1132 by 13 Benedictines tired of the rowdy monks at St. Mary's in York
Microsoft tests the noise of electronics in a room where you can hear your joints creak; it's measured at negative 20 of these units
The phrase "silent running" originated with this type of vessel going quiet to avoid detection
One square inch of silence is a project for maintaining the quiet of the Hoh Rain Forest in this state's Olympic national park

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response is made up of letters in the word "comprehensible".)

clues.text: To run off & wed
The ordinary form of written language, as opposed to verse
A fire's smoldering remains
Term applicable to both a tirade & a speech based on scripture delivered by clergy
To look like or be similar to

rounds.category: FILL IN THE ANIMAL MOVIE QUOTES

clues.text: "Babe": "That'll do, ___. That'll do"
"West Side Story": "The ___ are gonna have their way." "The Jets are gonna have their day"
"Raiders of the Lost Ark": "___. Why did it have to be ___?"
"Splash": "All my life I've been waiting for someone and when I find her... she's a ___"
"Fletch": "Can I borrow your towel for a sec? My car just hit a ___ ___"

rounds.comments: (Alex: What's on the western border of the place we name for you?)

clues.text: Arizona: this nearly 1,400-mile-long waterway
Tunisia: this country that itself has a western neighbor in Morocco
Germany: this country's provinces Gelderland & Groningen
Sri Lanka & Sumatra: this body of water
Northwest Territories: this other Canadian territory
Four legs good & bad: "FAR MAILMAN"

Hard-boiled favorite about a pilfered avian:
"HEELS OF CATTLEMAN"
The future after Ford: "WARNED VERB OWL"

About young German soldiers:
"NO FRET STREWN QUAIL TELETHON"

By Toni Morrison:
"SONS OF MONOLOG"
4 kids born at once; it's a cooler way of saying you had twin twins
Totally irrational in 1706, mathematician William Jones came up with this symbol
Without wild cards, 4 of a kind in poker is tough to beat--only these 2 hands can do it
clues.response: a straight flush & a royal flush

clues.text: This alphanumeric designation is the Army saying we don't want you
Pestilence, War, Famine & Death make up this biblical quartet
clues.response: the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse

rounds.text: Early in her career she translated romance novels into Spanish, often changing the dialogue to make the heroines smarter
